text:
17. B A distribution that has a greater percentage of small deviations from the mean and a
greater percentage of extremely large deviations from the mean will be leptokurtic and
will exhibit excess kurtosis (positive). The distribution will be more peaked and have
fatter tails than a normal distribution.
18. A A distribution with a mean greater than its median is positively skewed, or skewed to
the right. The skew “pulls” the mean. Note: Kurtosis deals with the overall shape of a
distribution and not its skewness.
